text: May Aimée Smith (1886–1962) was an English painter and engraver. ==Early life and education== Smith was born 16 March 1886 near Manchester, England. She studied wood engraving in Paris under Dmitri Galanis. ==Career== She had shows with the Society of Wood Engravers and at the Salon d'Automne in Paris. In 1949 she was included in the Seventh Annual Exhibition of Lithograpy and Wood Engraving at the Art Institute of Chicago.https://www.artic.edu/assets/6f4ddc0c-aaf0-2e37-244e-4fb06439c661 Her work is included in the collections of the Seattle Art Museum,http://art.seattleartmuseum.org/people/2526/may-aimee-smith the Auckland City Art Gallery,https://rfacdn.nz/artgallery/assets/media/1979-the- art-of-the-woodcut-catalogue.pdf the Nottingham City Museums and Galleries, the Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa and the Victoria & Albert Museum, London Smith died in 1962 at Birch Vale, Stockport, Cheshire, England. ==References== Category:1886 births Category:1962 deaths Category:20th-century British artists
title: May Aimée Smith
